settings.editor: A visit to Dubai’s amazing VR Park takes you into an imaginary world that showcases a futuristic concept, ‘shared escapism. The VR park Dubai Mall Park is so designed, that it seeks to challenge the realms of reality by creating a spellbinding mix of your perceptions and the reality you face. Such an approach has created some truly mind boggling experiences in the form of deeply immersive rides, vastly educating journeys, and engrossingly interactive games. So, it's time to buy the VR park Dubai tickets.

Have a go at the iconic game John Warwick Chronicles—a game that takes you to the extremes of your imagination as you are transformed into the Boogey Man armed with an AK 47 rifle. Moreover, among the 15 mesmerising games that beckon you at the VR Park, don’t forget to try Plummet which lets you experience skydiving without ever having to leave the ground.

VR Park Dubai Tickets Highlights

  • If you’ve selected private or shared transfer during booking, you are picked up from your centrally located hotel in Dubai in and around Deira, Bur Dubai. You may also reach VR Park by using desertdaytravels's transportation services.
  • The ‘Burj Drop’ is truly a thrilling experience that gives you goosebumps with the ride making you feel as if you are falling off the Burj Khalifa.
  • Enjoy ‘Dubai Drone,’ a skydiving experience of the future just the right stuff for adventure lovers. Don’t forget ‘Dune Bash’ either, a very thrilling off-road adventure
  • ‘VR Sports’ and ‘RobocomVR’ are virtual reality games that are truly engrossing
  • Enjoy lip smacking treats at the PVRK Café while enjoying the sights and sounds of the park
  • Have a go at interactive games after you’ve donned your VR headsets and grabbed unique props. These VR games are truly amazing and you can choose from many games with the most popular ones being APE-X, The Raft, John Warwick Chronicles, PAYDAY, and the Walking Dead Vr Outbreak

The Highlights

  • Dubai’s first-ever VR Park welcomes you into the multi-dimensional world of virtual reality where you push the boundaries of reality and let your imagination run wild
  • The Burj Drop which gives you the sensation of falling off the Burj Khalifa is one of the most popular rides here
  • Take a ride on the Dubai Drone so you can take a peek into how Dubai is likely to be in the year 2050
  • There are more than 30 rides to enjoy with horror, adventure, or action as their themes

How to Reach VR Park

  • By the Metro: Get off at the Burj Khalifa or the Dubai Mall Station from the metro. So, go to the main road from the station. A feeder bus connects the station to the mall and it plies every 15 minutes. You could also take the air-conditioned Metro Link Bridge. You would need no more than 15 minutes to reach the mall on foot.
  • By Car:  Drive along the Financial Centre Road after taking the first interchange from the centre of Dubai to reach the Dubai Mall. The approach road to the Dubai Mall shall fall on your right.Also you can rent a car from desertdaytravels.
  • By Shared/Private Transfer: You can also book shared/private transfers to the venue from your centrally located accommodation in Dubai.

FAQs

Q. In which year was the VR Park Dubai built?

The VR Park came up at the Dubai Mall in the year 2018. It’s spread across 7,000 square meters on the mall’s Level 2.

Q. How many zones does the VR Park have?

There are 18 zones in the VR Park Dubai which have been segregated on the basis of the minimum height required for the rides, age groups, single/multi player, action/cinema. You are sure to find the attractions in every zone very thrilling.

Q. How long does it take to enjoy a visit to VR Park?

It’s best that you set aside an entire day to cover the park which has as many as 18 zones. You wouldn’t want to miss the top Dubai attractions. Therefore, you should set aside enough time for the visit.

Q. What food options are available at VR Park?

There are various food options available at Dubai Mall which offers cuisine from many nations. Even VR Park itself has many food joints serving mouthwatering treats, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian.

Q. What exactly is VR Park Dubai?

VR Park Dubai is a virtual reality theme park located in The Dubai Mall, where you can immerse yourself in various interactive experiences using advanced VR technology. It offers a wide range of attractions, including games, rides, and educational experiences for all ages. This is indeed one place where you will get to enjoy a whole bunch of interesting games.

Q. What kind of experiences can I expect from VR Park?

VR Park Dubai offers a variety of experiences that cater to different interests and preferences. You can enjoy thrilling rides, interactive games, and educational simulations that take you to different worlds and dimensions. The experience here is second to none. The whole experience is very educational for people of all age groups. In other words, the amusement park will give you an experience that you will never forget. Also, don't forget to visit the Dubai Aquarium & Underwater Zoo in Dubai Mall to experience the most thrilling marine adventure.

Q. How do I book VR Park Dubai tickets?

You can book VR Park Dubai tickets online through our website. Simply select the date and time you wish to visit and complete the booking process. Alternatively, you can also purchase tickets at the park's ticket counter upon arrival. You should book your tickets in advance as the slots get filled out fast. You should visit during the early hours on weekends as the crowd is still less.

Q. Are there any age restrictions?

Most of the experiences at VR Park Dubai are suitable for all ages, but some have height or age restrictions. We advise you to check the park's website or contact their customer service team for more information before making your booking. Some of the attractions may have some requirements for age and it is best to learn about them in advance.

Q. What are the operating hours?

VR Park Dubai is open daily from 10:00 am to 12:00 am. However, operating hours may vary on special occasions or holidays. On festive days or on Ramadan the timings may change so check their website before you go ahead.
